University, Alabama.
March 19, 1953
Mr. Merle Kimball
Station KTOT
Tacoma Public Schools
P.0. Box 1357
Tacoma, Washington
Dear Mr. Kimball:
Please permit me to welcome you to membership in the NAEB and to
assure you of our interest in making the full facilities of our organization
available to you in any way wherein we may be of service.
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters, now 28 years
old, has always been the voice of educational institutions and individuals
who are interested in utilizing ratio and television as an educational tool.
Hiring the past several years the organization has increased its activities
many times and its scope of influence. You are, no doubt, aware of the NAEB
Tape Network whereby many of the world's finest programs are made available
far broadcasting on the educational stations throughout the country. This
activity has expanded from a three programs per week "bicycle1* network to
direct service on approximately eight hours of programming per week. During
the past twelve months, through direct negotiations with countries of Western
Europe, we have increased the flow of cultural and informational programs
in both directions to a considerable extent and expect to eppand our inter¬
national exchange considerably during the current year.
Each year NAEB conducts several seminars and workshops for the
upgrading of personnel and through a grants-in-aid program made possible
by the Fund for Adult Education has been able to contribute to the improve¬
ment of programming on the local level to a significant extent. This" year
we have created a special committee within the organization to devote
particular attention to the oroblers of our associate members and two
special committees are spending a considerable amount of time to the
problems of school stations. We hone to continue tp serve the needs of
educational radio and television stations and educational radio and tele¬
vision production groups increasingly in the future.
I trust that your membership in NAEB will offer stimulating and
rewarding contacts, information, and services during the year ahead. Please
feel free to call upon me directly or upon our headquarters office for any
services we may be able to render.
Very sincerely yours.
GA:pse
Graydon Ausmus
President
